events.event_description: Henry Hub natural gas price fell to $1.21 per MMBtu, reaching an all-time inflation-adjusted low.
events.citation: The U.S. benchmark Henry Hub daily natural gas price fell to $1.21 per million British thermal units (MMBtu) on November 8 and November 11, 2024, an all-time low in inflation-adjusted dollars.

events.event_description: U.S. natural gas storage reached 3,922 billion cubic feet at the end of injection season, the highest level since 2016.
events.citation: U.S. inventories ended the injection season on October 31 at 3,922 billion cubic feet, and the U.S. natural gas market enters the winter of 2024–25 with the most natural gas in storage since 2016.

events.event_description: Henry Hub spot prices spiked to over $13/MMBtu due to well-below-normal temperatures across the United States.
events.citation: Early this year, Henry Hub spot prices spiked to over $13/MMBtu in January due to well-below-normal temperatures across most of the United States.

events.event_description: U.S. marketed natural gas production forecast to average 113 billion cubic feet per day, maintaining 2023's record high levels.
events.citation: we forecast marketed U.S. natural gas production to average 113 billion cubic feet per day in 2024, relatively unchanged from 2023's record high.
